BioData: Democrat, of St. Croix, VI; born in New York, NY, May 13, 1966; B.S.F.S, Georgetown University, Washington, DC, 1988; J.D., American University School of Law, Washington, DC, 1994; professional: Bronx Assistant District Attorney, Counsel on U.S. House of Representatives Committee on Ethics, Senior Counsel to the Deputy Attorney General at U.S. Justice Department, Deputy General Counsel at United Health Group; General Counsel Virgin Islands Economic Development Authority; family: spouse, Jonathan Buckney-Small; children: Jeremiah, Christian, Ariel, Israel Duffy, and Taliah Buckney-Small; caucuses: Congressional Black Caucus; Congressional Womens Caucus; Congressional Caribbean Caucus; Congressional Caucus on Public-Private Partnerships; Congressional Coastal Communities Caucus; Congressional Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCU) Caucus; Congressional Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) Export Caucus; House National Guard and Reserve Components Caucus; committees: Agriculture; Oversight and Government Reform; elected to the 114th Congress on November 4, 2014.
Name: Stacey  Plaskett
